meanings.definition: (adjective) conforming to dietary laws; fit or allowed to be eaten according to Jewish dietary laws
meanings.sent1: The rabbi ensured the food was kosher before the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The kosher meal was prepared in accordance with Jewish traditions.
meanings.sent3: The kosher cookies disappeared quickly at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was as clear and kosher as a mountain stream.
meanings.sent5: The kosher label on the product reassured the customers of its quality.

meanings.definition: (verb) to make something legitimate or acceptable; to approve or endorse
meanings.sent1: He needed to kosher the document before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to kosher the proposal for further consideration.
meanings.sent3: She had to kosher her excuse to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent4: The judge's ruling helped to kosher the controversial decision.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to kosher the new policy to gain employee support.

meanings.definition: (noun) food that is prepared according to Jewish dietary laws
meanings.sent1: The family enjoyed a delicious kosher meal together.
meanings.sent2: The store offered a variety of kosher products for sale.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was filled with tasty kosher treats.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant specialized in serving authentic kosher dishes.
meanings.sent5: The wedding reception featured a buffet of kosher delicacies.
